unnormalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why Film Festivals are the Real Deal
normalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why Film Festivals are the Real Deal

unnormalised: Okay, Bollywood buffs, let's be real. We all love a good SRK romance or a high-octane action flick from Dharma Productions. But have you ever ventured into the world of film festivals? Trust me, it's a whole other level of cinematic awesomeness.
normalised: Okay, Bollywood buffs, let's be real. We all love a good S R K romance or a high-octane action flick from Dharma Productions. But have you ever ventured into the world of film festivals? Trust me, it's a whole other level of cinematic awesomeness.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: Bollywood is the catered wedding reception, all glitz and glam. Film festivals? They're the hole-in-the-wall restaurant serving up the most authentic, flavourful food you've ever tasted. You might not recognize all the ingredients, but you'll definitely come back for more.
normalised: Think of it like this: Bollywood is the catered wedding reception, all glitz and glam. Film festivals? They're the hole-in-the-wall restaurant serving up the most authentic, flavourful food you've ever tasted. You might not recognize all the ingredients, but you'll definitely come back for more.

unnormalised: These festivals are a celebration of storytelling from all corners of the globe. From indie dramas to thought-provoking documentaries, you'll find films that push boundaries and challenge your perspectives. Forget the usual song and dance – although, you might find some killer dance sequences in unexpected places!
normalised: These festivals are a celebration of storytelling from all corners of the globe. From indie dramas to thought-provoking documentaries, you'll find films that push boundaries and challenge your perspectives. Forget the usual song and dance – although, you might find some killer dance sequences in unexpected places!

unnormalised: I remember catching a screening at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa a few years back. It completely changed my view on what cinema could be. This tiny film from Kerala, made with a budget of maybe Rs. 5 lakhs, was more moving than some Rs. 50 Crore Bollywood productions I'd seen!

unnormalised: Plus, film festivals are a fantastic place to discover emerging talent. You might just witness the birth of the next Anurag Kashyap or Aparna Sen! They often feature Q&A sessions with directors and actors, giving you a chance to peek behind the curtain and understand the creative process. You might even bump into them grabbing a chai at a nearby stall!

unnormalised: So, ditch the Netflix binge for a weekend and explore the local film festival scene. There are tons popping up all over India these days - from Mumbai to Chennai to Kolkata. You might have to travel a few km, but it’s totally worth it.

unnormalised: You'll be exposed to new cultures, new ideas, and a whole lot of amazing films that you won't find anywhere else. Who knows, you might even discover your new favourite director! And hey, at the very least, you'll have some seriously cool stories to tell at your next chai session.
